bug.short_desc: nautilus sometimes responds very sluggish to mouse doubleclicks on icons in folder windows

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
I'm running f22 (gnome3 desktop, nautilus as file manager). It happens almost always that nautilus does not respond to a double click on icons in some folder window. Trying to change the mouse behaviour by gnome-control-center was unseccessful.
All updates are installed.
But if I use thunar for example (instead of nautilus), the mouse-clicking behaviour of thunar works as expected.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
nautilus-3.16.2-1.fc22.x86_64
How reproducible:
Steps to Reproduce: 1.Double click on some desktop icon or folder icon 2. 3.
Actual results: Nothing happens. I have to repeat the double click until nautilus does something.
Expected results: Nautilus responds immediately.
Additional info:
An additional experience: Clicking on the filename text (under the icon symbol) will help and open immediately.
